{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Office Assistant",
  "description": "Ronsberger Nigeria Limited is a reputable Healthcare services group, involved in the management of hospitals, clinics, community health plan, health management organization (HMO) and provision of capacity building to the health care sector at the national level.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Garki, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Answer and direct phone calls.
	Receiving both incoming and outgoing mails.
	Dispatching of official mails
	Typing of medical bills from Hospitals
	Maintain a good filing system.


Requirements and Skills


	Proven experience as an Office Assistant
	Knowledge of office management systems and procedures
	Working knowledge of office equipment, like printers and Photocopiers
	Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS PowerPoint, in particular)
	Attention to details
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.e


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;Anthony.ugwu@ronsbergerhmo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Office Assistant Job at Ronsberger Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Ronsberger Nigeria Limited is a reputable Healthcare services group, involved in the management of hospitals, clinics, community health plan, health management organization (HMO) and provision of capacity building to the health care sector at the national level.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant

Job Location: Garki, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Answer and direct phone calls.
	Receiving both incoming and outgoing mails.
	Dispatching of official mails
	Typing of medical bills from Hospitals
	Maintain a good filing system.


Requirements and Skills


	Proven experience as an Office Assistant
	Knowledge of office management systems and procedures
	Working knowledge of office equipment, like printers and Photocopiers
	Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS PowerPoint, in particular)
	Attention to details
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.e


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: Anthony.ugwu@ronsbergerhmo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Content Creator",
  "description": "Above Lifestyle is a premium service restaurant, lounge and club located in Lekki, Ikotun and Abuja.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Content Creation (Photography &amp; Visuals):


	Capture high-quality photos and videos of events, lounges, restaurants, staff, and signature experiences.
	Produce lifestyle, food &amp; beverage, and behind-the-scenes content for digital campaigns.
	Edit and curate visual assets to reflect the Above Lifestyle brand identity (premium, exclusive, luxury).
	Collaborate with marketing and operations teams to plan shoots that align with promotional calendars.
	Manage media library, ensuring all visual assets are well-organized, tagged, and accessible.


Email Marketing (Plus Experience):


	Develop and execute email marketing campaigns to promote events, offers, and experiences.
	Write compelling, brand-aligned email copy and design visually engaging newsletters.
	Manage subscriber lists, segment audiences, and personalize campaigns to drive engagement.
	Track, analyze, and report email performance (open rates, CTR, conversions) and optimize for continuous improvement.
	Ensure email designs are mobile-friendly and aligned with global hospitality standards.


Cross-Functional Collaboration:


	Work with the bar, restaurant, and event teams to create timely promotions and campaigns.
	Support guest experience campaigns with content that enhances loyalty and brand awareness.
	Provide creative support for internal communications and corporate brand initiatives.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Media, or related field (or equivalent experience).
	Proven experience in photography/videography with a strong portfolio.
	Proficiency in editing software (Lightroom, Photoshop, Premiere Pro, or similar).
	At least beginner experience with email marketing platforms Strong copywriting and storytelling skills with attention to luxury branding.
	Knowledge of hospitality trends, especially premium and lifestyle segments, is an advantage.
	Ability to multitask, manage time effectively, and work flexible hours (including nights/weekends during events).
",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-07",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Content Creator Job at Above Lifestyle




        
    

        
        Above Lifestyle is a premium service restaurant, lounge and club located in Lekki, Ikotun and Abuja.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Content Creation (Photography & Visuals):
     

            
    




	Capture high-quality photos and videos of events, lounges, restaurants, staff, and signature experiences.
	Produce lifestyle, food & beverage, and behind-the-scenes content for digital campaigns.
	Edit and curate visual assets to reflect the Above Lifestyle brand identity (premium, exclusive, luxury).
	Collaborate with marketing and operations teams to plan shoots that align with promotional calendars.
	Manage media library, ensuring all visual assets are well-organized, tagged, and accessible.


Email Marketing (Plus Experience):


	Develop and execute email marketing campaigns to promote events, offers, and experiences.
	Write compelling, brand-aligned email copy and design visually engaging newsletters.
	Manage subscriber lists, segment audiences, and personalize campaigns to drive engagement.
	Track, analyze, and report email performance (open rates, CTR, conversions) and optimize for continuous improvement.
	Ensure email designs are mobile-friendly and aligned with global hospitality standards.


Cross-Functional Collaboration:


	Work with the bar, restaurant, and event teams to create timely promotions and campaigns.
	Support guest experience campaigns with content that enhances loyalty and brand awareness.
	Provide creative support for internal communications and corporate brand initiatives.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Media, or related field (or equivalent experience).
	Proven experience in photography/videography with a strong portfolio.
	Proficiency in editing software (Lightroom, Photoshop, Premiere Pro, or similar).
	At least beginner experience with email marketing platforms Strong copywriting and storytelling skills with attention to luxury branding.
	Knowledge of hospitality trends, especially premium and lifestyle segments, is an advantage.
	Ability to multitask, manage time effectively, and work flexible hours (including nights/weekends during events).
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Officer",
  "description": "Spotlight Supermarket is a fast-growing retail store located at Lotto-Simawa opposite Ndiviz Filling Station off Lagos-Ibadan Expressway.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lotto Simawa Road - Mowe, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Spotlight Supermarket is hiring a proactive and detail-oriented Inventory Officer to manage inventory in both the store and on the sales floor.
	The ideal candidate will oversee stock movement from delivery, storage, and shelf replenishment, ensuring product availability, accuracy, and organization across the supermarket.


Key Responsibilities


	Receive incoming stock and verify accuracy against invoices/delivery notes
	Tag and label items with barcodes or batch numbers for tracking
	Organize and arrange stock properly in the storage area using FIFO/FEFO methods
	Ensure timely shelf replenishment and restocking of fast-moving items
	Collaborate with floor staff to maintain tidy and well-stocked shelves
	Monitor and record the movement of goods using the POS/inventory system
	Conduct daily or weekly shelf counts to prevent stockouts
	Identify and report expired, damaged, or slow-moving items
	Assist with monthly inventory audits and system reconciliation
	Communicate effectively with purchasing, cashiers, and supervisors


Requirements


	Minimum of HND with relevant experience
	Experience with inventory control, warehousing, or shelf management
	Familiar with stock rotation principles (FIFO/FEFO)
	Basic computer skills (POS systems or Excel is an advantage)
	Honest, organized, and dependable
	Able to lift and move stock safely
	Good communication and teamwork skills
	Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends


Benefits


	Competitive and fair salary
	Friendly and professional work environment
	Training and career advancement opportunities
	Staff discounts and performance incentives


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;spotlightsupermart@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Inventory Officer Job at Spotlight Supermarket




        
    

        
        Spotlight Supermarket is a fast-growing retail store located at Lotto-Simawa opposite Ndiviz Filling Station off Lagos-Ibadan Expressway.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer
Job Location: Lotto Simawa Road - Mowe, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Spotlight Supermarket is hiring a proactive and detail-oriented Inventory Officer to manage inventory in both the store and on the sales floor.
	The ideal candidate will oversee stock movement from delivery, storage, and shelf replenishment, ensuring product availability, accuracy, and organization across the supermarket.


Key Responsibilities


	Receive incoming stock and verify accuracy against invoices/delivery notes
	Tag and label items with barcodes or batch numbers for tracking
	Organize and arrange stock properly in the storage area using FIFO/FEFO methods
	Ensure timely shelf replenishment and restocking of fast-moving items
	Collaborate with floor staff to maintain tidy and well-stocked shelves
	Monitor and record the movement of goods using the POS/inventory system
	Conduct daily or weekly shelf counts to prevent stockouts
	Identify and report expired, damaged, or slow-moving items
	Assist with monthly inventory audits and system reconciliation
	Communicate effectively with purchasing, cashiers, and supervisors


Requirements


	Minimum of HND with relevant experience
	Experience with inventory control, warehousing, or shelf management
	Familiar with stock rotation principles (FIFO/FEFO)
	Basic computer skills (POS systems or Excel is an advantage)
	Honest, organized, and dependable
	Able to lift and move stock safely
	Good communication and teamwork skills
	Willingness to work flexible hours, including weekends


Benefits


	Competitive and fair salary
	Friendly and professional work environment
	Training and career advancement opportunities
	Staff discounts and performance incentives


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: spotlightsupermart@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graphics Designer",
  "description": "BROOT Consulting is a forward-thinking firm that helps businesses achieve their goals through&nbsp;Strategy Advisory, Innovation Management, Research Services, Project Management, Leadership Development, and People Practice. We partner with our clients to build their capabilities to thrive in the dynamic and competitive world of today. Our approach is people-centric, delivering solutions that are customised to your organisation and its context.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Hybrid / Remote-friendly
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a creative and detail-oriented Graphics Designer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing high-quality visual content across digital and print platforms, ensuring brand consistency and effective communication. Experience in video editing and content creation will be a strong added advantage.


Responsibilities


	Design engaging graphics for social media, websites, marketing campaigns, and print materials.
	Collaborate with the creative and marketing teams to bring ideas to life through visuals.
	Ensure all designs align with brand guidelines and maintain consistency in style, colours, and messaging.
	Edit and produce short video content for social media and campaigns (advantage).
	Stay updated on industry design trends, tools, and best practices.
	Manage multiple design projects and deliver high-quality work within deadlines.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Graphics Designer (portfolio required).
	Proficiency in Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or CorelDRAW.
	Strong understanding of typography, colour theory, and layout design.
	Experience with video editing and motion graphics is an added advantage.
	Creativity, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently.
	Strong communication and time-management skills.


Benefits


	Salary of N120,000 &ndash; N150,000 monthly.
	Flexible working arrangements (mostly remote).
	Opportunity to work on diverse projects with creative freedom.
	A collaborative and supportive work environment.
	Growth opportunities within the team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to:&nbsp;info@brootc.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Graphics Designer Job at BROOT Consulting




        
    

        
        BROOT Consulting is a forward-thinking firm that helps businesses achieve their goals through Strategy Advisory, Innovation Management, Research Services, Project Management, Leadership Development, and People Practice. We partner with our clients to build their capabilities to thrive in the dynamic and competitive world of today. Our approach is people-centric, delivering solutions that are customised to your organisation and its context.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location: Hybrid / Remote-friendly
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a creative and detail-oriented Graphics Designer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing high-quality visual content across digital and print platforms, ensuring brand consistency and effective communication. Experience in video editing and content creation will be a strong added advantage.


Responsibilities


	Design engaging graphics for social media, websites, marketing campaigns, and print materials.
	Collaborate with the creative and marketing teams to bring ideas to life through visuals.
	Ensure all designs align with brand guidelines and maintain consistency in style, colours, and messaging.
	Edit and produce short video content for social media and campaigns (advantage).
	Stay updated on industry design trends, tools, and best practices.
	Manage multiple design projects and deliver high-quality work within deadlines.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Graphics Designer (portfolio required).
	Proficiency in Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or CorelDRAW.
	Strong understanding of typography, colour theory, and layout design.
	Experience with video editing and motion graphics is an added advantage.
	Creativity, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently.
	Strong communication and time-management skills.


Benefits


	Salary of N120,000 – N150,000 monthly.
	Flexible working arrangements (mostly remote).
	Opportunity to work on diverse projects with creative freedom.
	A collaborative and supportive work environment.
	Growth opportunities within the team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: info@brootc.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "TopHire Africa is a timeless and innovative HR-Consulting Service provider that&#39;s geared towards delivering recruitment and training of qualitative verified talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos Island, Lagos

Main Key Responsibilities


	Welcome visitors and staff in a professional and friendly manner.
	Answer and direct phone calls, emails, and general inquiries promptly.
	Maintain the reception area and ensure it is clean and welcoming
	Support administrative tasks including filing, data entry, printing, and record keeping.
	Provide general support to the admin team and other departments as required.
	Provide administrative support to different departments as needed.
	Manage appointment schedules and assist with meeting coordination.
	Handle incoming and outgoing mail, deliveries, and official correspondence.
	Maintain visitor logs and ensure security and sign-in protocols are followed.
	Relay important information to relevant personnel in a timely manner.
	Address and resolve client and visitor inquiries or redirect them to the appropriate department.
	Monitor and replenish office supplies as needed.


Qualification/Experience/Key Competencies


	Minimum of BSc Degree
	Prior experience in customer service/front office role is preferred.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).
	Professional appearance and a positive attitude.
	Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
	Calm and composed, especially in handling inquiries and managing busy front desk hours.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;tophireafrica@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Front Desk Executive Job at TopHire Africa




        
    

        
        TopHire Africa is a timeless and innovative HR-Consulting Service provider that's geared towards delivering recruitment and training of qualitative verified talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Executive

Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos

Main Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Welcome visitors and staff in a professional and friendly manner.
	Answer and direct phone calls, emails, and general inquiries promptly.
	Maintain the reception area and ensure it is clean and welcoming
	Support administrative tasks including filing, data entry, printing, and record keeping.
	Provide general support to the admin team and other departments as required.
	Provide administrative support to different departments as needed.
	Manage appointment schedules and assist with meeting coordination.
	Handle incoming and outgoing mail, deliveries, and official correspondence.
	Maintain visitor logs and ensure security and sign-in protocols are followed.
	Relay important information to relevant personnel in a timely manner.
	Address and resolve client and visitor inquiries or redirect them to the appropriate department.
	Monitor and replenish office supplies as needed.


Qualification/Experience/Key Competencies


	Minimum of BSc Degree
	Prior experience in customer service/front office role is preferred.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).
	Professional appearance and a positive attitude.
	Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
	Calm and composed, especially in handling inquiries and managing busy front desk hours.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tophireafrica@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
